title: Semiconductor Manufacturing and Process Control | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This micro-credential covers key topics such as CMOS technology, advanced fabrication techniques, and more, equipping learners for advanced roles in the semiconductor industry.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
This micro-credential covers key topics such as CMOS technology, advanced fabrication techniques, and more, equipping learners for advanced roles in the semiconductor industry.

The continuous expansion of the semiconductor industry in Singapore highlights the need for specialised courses in semiconductor manufacturing, to build a skilled workforce ready to meet industry demands. This will ensure Singapore remains competitive in the high-tech sector, driving both innovation and efficiency.

Designed to address significant skill gaps in semiconductor manufacturing, this micro-credential aims to prepare learners for advanced roles in the ever-evolving industry. Learners will delve deeply into Complementary metal–oxide–semiconductor (CMOS) technology, exploring its evolution and scaling trends. This includes the application of complex process integration methodologies for various semiconductor devices, including CMOS, memory, photonics, and MEMS.

This micro-credential also offers a comprehensive study of advanced fabrication techniques, metrology, and inspection tools. Learners will focus on rigorous process control, risk assessment, and yield management, preparing them to address real-world challenges in semiconductor production with a focus on improving quality, efficiency, and yield.

Learners will focus on rigorous process control, risk assessment, and yield management. This will prepare learners to address real-world challenges in semiconductor production with a focus on improving quality, efficiency, and yield.
This micro-credential is part of the
CSM Pathway in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
Learners who aim to pursue a career in the semiconductor manufacturing industry including engineers in the following specialisation:
Learners should have a fundamental knowledge in the following:
Semiconductor devices and fabrication processes either through formal training or experience in semiconductor industry

This micro-credential is predominantly delivered through a competency-based education (CBE) approach where learners acquire and demonstrate mastery of knowledge and skills that are directly relevant to job functions. This prepares them to be industry-ready where they can apply their newly acquired competencies to their work.
The above are competency units that constitute this micro-credential. Upon completion of the micro-credential, you will be able to:
Analyse the semiconductor manufacturing flow including advancement in material and fabrication technologies for nanoscale devices
Apply understanding of semiconductor manufacturing concepts, technologies, and tools to analyse manufacturing processes for their use, effectiveness, and relevance in the integrated process flow
Apply statistical process control, process optimisation, risk analysis and yield management methodologies for semiconductor manufacturing

During the course, you will have access to a team of qualified success coaches who can work with you on learning strategies or to develop a personalised learning plan. Through the success coaches, you can gain access to a wide range of resources and support services, and be empowered with the necessary tools to navigate your learning journey successfully.
Associate Professor / Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor / Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Zheng Jianxin is an Associate Professor of the engineering cluster at Singapore Institute of Technology. Currently, he is also the Programme Leader for Electronics and Data Engineering programme. His current research interest is on semiconductor device physics and simulation, transport system simulation and data analytics. He holds a Bachelor of Engineering and Master of Engineering in Electrical & Electronics Engineering from the National University of Singapore (NUS), and PhD (Advanced Materials for Micro and Nano Systems) from Singapore-MIT Alliance in NUS.
Senior Lecturer, Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Republic Polytechnic
Senior Lecturer, Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Republic Polytechnic

Dr. Koh Kah How, a Senior Lecturer at Republic Polytechnic (RP), joined the Diploma in Electrical and Electronic Engineering (DEEE) team in 2017. He has since taken on several academic appointments, including Programme Head for the Part-Time Diploma in Engineering (Electrical & Electronic) and the Specialist Diploma in Semiconductor Manufacturing. Before his tenure at RP, Dr. Koh was a Principal Quality Engineer at GlobalFoundries Singapore, where he applied quality tools and Lean Six Sigma methodologies to enhance manufacturing robustness during the design and development stages. He holds a Doctor of Philosophy and a Bachelor of Engineering, both from the National University of Singapore, awarded in 2013 and 2009, respectively.
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Kian Ann NG (M’06-SM’18) received the B.E. degree in electrical and electronic engineering and the M.E. degree in IC design from Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, in 2000 and 2005, respectively. He received his PhD from the National University of Singapore in 2015. From 2000 to 2009, he has held senior technical positions with the following companies: STMicroelectronics, Chartered Semiconductor Manufacturing and Oxford Semiconductors. He has designed EEG/ECG mixed-signal front ends, switched-capacitor circuits, RF identification circuits, image sensors, ESD/IO circuits, USB(1.0 to 3.0) SERDES and Firewire SERDES, IEC60601-compliant devices. From 2010 to 2020, he was a Research Fellow at the National University of Singapore. He has authored and co-authored more than 30 technical articles and holds 6 US patents.  From 2020 to  2024, he was an assistant professor at the DigiPen Institute of Technology Singapore.

Kian Ann is a senior member of the IEEE and an active committee member of the IEEE Solid-State Circuits Society (Singapore Chapter). He currently serves as Chair of the IEEE SSCS Singapore Chapter (SC37) from January 2025. Prior to this, he held the roles of Vice-Chair from January 2023 to 2024 and Treasurer from January 2022 to 2023. In addition to these appointments, Kian Ann was the Treasurer, Local Arrangement Chair, and Technical Program Committee member for the International Conference on IC Design and Technology (ICICDT 2024) in September 2024. He also served as the Local Arrangement Chair for the IEEE International Symposium on Circuits and Systems (ISCAS 2024) in May 2024.
A Specialist Certificate in Semiconductor Manufacturing and Process Control will be issued to learners who:
Attend at least 75% of the course and
Undertake and pass all credit bearing assessments
The learner will undertake a combination of written examinations and reports preparation
The full fee for this course is S$10,006.20.
will be collected before course commencement.
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.

Should you decide to convert to the degree pathway, you will be subject to SIT’s tuition fees and may qualify for the Ministry of Education (MOE) tuition grant, based on eligibility criteria set by MOE. Please note that the SkillsFuture subsidy will no longer be applicable once you convert to the degree pathway.
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.
Subscribe to our mailing list to learn about the latest dates as soon as they become available.

Earn micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering (via the CSM Pathway) and develop competencies in robotics and automation, operational excellence, semiconductor manufacturing, energy systems, and more. Stack these micro-credentials towards a Bachelor of Engineering (Honours) in Electrical and Electronic Engineering at SIT.
More alumni return to S’pore universities to study, but more support needed
More people are returning to their alma mater for further studies over the past few years, with government support and more alumni engagement.
Career Growth and Transition, Competency-based Education
Improving Patient Outcomes through Advanced Clinical Supervision Competency

The Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) taps on evidence-based education practices to address the increasing demand for advanced clinical supervision competencies among Allied Health Professionals and improve patient outcomes.
Health Sciences, Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation, Competency-based Education
Upskilling is Not an Uphill Task

Questions like “Am I too old?”, “Will I be able to keep up?” and “Can I afford it?” are often on the minds of adult learners when considering upskilling and upgrading. Robin Ngan, Director of the SITLEARN, tackles these questions and shares tips for how to make the most of one’s lifelong learning journey.
Competency-based Education, Career Growth and Transition
What’s needed for stackable microcredentials toward a degree?
Forest Tan describes how to begin creating a flexible pathway where learners can accumulate microcredentials aligned to industry that can stack toward a degree.
How to coach in-employment lifelong learners for success
A team from Singapore Institute of Technology offers insights from working with in-employment learners who are seeking to upskill by studying for degrees.
The future of learning: How competency-based education is shaping skills development

As the shelf-life of skills shortens, it's time to rethink the traditional approach to upskilling. With competency-based education, employees are able to master the skills that directly impact their careers, and employers are able to assess competency accurately.
Gain insights into the fundamental principles of Radio Frequency (RF) and microwave engineering in alignment with Singapore's Smart Industry Readiness Index.

Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical expertise in electronic systems to model, analyse, and interpret performance and specifications efficiently. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Electrical and Electronic Engineering.
BEng (Hons) in Electrical & Electronic Engineering (via the CSM Pathway)
Information Security Risk Management and Audit

Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical expertise in information systems audit, security management, and risk management based on Agile. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Applied Computing.
Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Computing (via the CSM Pathway)
Information Security, Cybersecurity, Risk Management, Audit, Competency-based Education

Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical foundation in digital and IT fundamentals, programming, logic and discrete structures. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Applied Computing.
Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Computing (via the CSM Pathway)
Programming and Software Development, Computer Architecture, Competency-based Education

Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical expertise in renewable integration, energy storage, and smart grid deployment. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Electrical and Electronics Engineering.
BEng (Hons) in Electrical & Electronic Engineering (via the CSM Pathway)
Electrical Engineering, Power and Clean Energy, Sustainability, Competency-based Education

Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical expertise in engineering design, 3D modelling and analysis and prototype development. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Infrastructure and Systems Engineering.
BEng (Hons) in Infrastructure & Systems Engineering (via the CSM Pathway)
Systems Engineering, Transport Engineering, Competency-based Education

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
